thinking: The first turn will focus on initiating resource collection with one worker and commanding the remaining worker to attack the enemy base. Additionally, the base will be instructed to train a new worker to reinforce resource gathering and offensive capabilities in subsequent turns.

The highest priority is to assign a worker to harvest resources. Since only one action is allowed this turn, I will assign the worker at (2,1) to harvest the resource at (0,0) and return it to the base at (2,1).
The highest priority is to continue harvesting. All other units need to attack the enemy base.
The only unit I have is the base. I need to train a worker.
I need to assign a worker to harvest and all other units to attack. Since there are no other units besides the worker, I will assign the worker to harvest.

The turn is 50, indicating the game is progressing. I need to maintain resource harvesting with one worker, train workers at the base, and aggressively attack the enemy base with other units. Since I only have one worker and a base, I should command the worker to harvest and the base to train.

The game has reached turn 60. The strategy is to make sure one worker is harvesting, the base is training workers and the rest of the units are attacking. Currently there is one worker and one base.  I will have the worker harvest and the base train a new worker to keep populating the map with workers

Prioritize aggression to eliminate enemy units. Since there is a worker available, let's attack with that worker. The only unit I control is at (2,1) which is the base. It is idle. So I will train a worker.
Prioritize harvesting with one worker and attacking with the rest. No barracks yet, so just attack with all workers except one. Base keeps training workers.

The highest priority is to harvest resources with one worker. Since no worker is assigned to resource collection, I need to assign one worker to harvest resources. I'll select the worker at (2, 2) and have them harvest the resource at (0, 0) and return to base at (2, 1). The worker at (2,2) will attack the enemy base. The base unit at (2,1) will continue to produce worker units.

The top priority is to keep training workers and attacking the enemy. Since one worker is already set to harvest, I will order the base to train new workers. Then, I'll order the enemy worker to attack the enemy base.
